title: Why AI + Publisher Rocket is a Dream Combination for Authors

tactics.name: AI-Driven Keyword Expansion
tactics.description: Use AI to generate seed keywords for Amazon search, then analyze them with Publisher Rocket for search volume and competition data.
steps: Input a keyword phrase into an AI chatbot to generate 50+ related seed keywords
Use Publisher Rocket to check search volume, competitive score, and BSR for each keyword
caveats: AI-generated keywords may lack search volume data without Publisher Rocket validation
source_quotes: the AI doesn't actually know if they're good keywords

tactics.name: AI + Publisher Rocket Keyword Research
tactics.description: Use AI to generate seed keywords and Publisher Rocket to filter for low competition and high search volume.
steps: Filter by competitive score and search volume
Adjust book ideas based on keyword findings
caveats: May require extensive filtering when results are sparse
source_quotes: we have Merlin books so that one has an estimated search per month of 262

heuristics.name: Low-Competition Keyword Filter
heuristics.condition: If a keyword has <100 monthly searches and BSR >50,000, prioritize it
source_quotes: the number of Amazon Searchers per month is less than 100

heuristics.name: Competitive Score Prioritization
heuristics.condition: If competitive score is below 100 and search volume above 200, prioritize keywords
source_quotes: as long as it's above 100 I'm usually okay if the competitive score is this low

claims.statement: Publisher Rocket provides competitive score data for Amazon keywords
source_quotes: it makes it very clear whether a keyword is one that you want to target

claims.statement: Authors often wait to start non-fiction books until finding low competition, high volume keywords
source_quotes: many authors that will not even begin a book... until they have found a keyword... low competition and high volume

niche_patterns.example: Arthurian Legends + Camelot Tales + Fantasy History
niche_patterns.description: Combine mythological themes with specific niche subtopics in underserved Amazon categories
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Leverages specific keyword clusters with lower competition in specialized categories
source_quotes: categories that are a little underserved

niche_patterns.example: Arthurian fantasy + Camelot myths + Christian readers
niche_patterns.description: Combine genre elements with specific narrative themes and target audiences for niche discovery
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Targets underserved markets with defined search intent
source_quotes: readers of those keywords might enjoy a book on Arthurian fantasy
